fr.zcraft.quartzlib.components.i18n

Class I

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zcraft.quartzlib.components.i18n.I

  • public class I
extends Object
    A shortcut to translate texts.

    Use I.t("text", ...), or statically import I.t and use t("text", ...) to translate something.

    The parameters

    Translated string accept parameters in the following format: {0}, {1}, etc. These tokens are replaced with the given parameters at runtime; the first parameter replaces the {0} token, the second one, {1}, and so on.

    Other parameters related options are available; see the {@code MessageFormat} documentation for more details.

    Note that the escaping behavior of the ' character presented in the linked documentation above does not apply to these translated texts, for convenience reasons.

    Extracting strings from the source with xgettext

    Give the following parameters to extract these strings to a .po file with xgettext:

         # Lines: reset, with traditional imports and with static ones.
     -k
     -k"I.t" -k"I.tn:1,2" -k"I.tc:1c,2" -k"I.tcn:1c,2,3" -k"I.tl:2" -k"I.tln:2,3" -k"I.tlc:2c,3" -k"I.tlcn:2c,3,4"
         -k"I.sendT:2" -k"I.sendTn:2,3" -k"I.sendTc:2c,3" -k"I.sendTcn:2c,3,4"
     -k"t" -k"tn:1,2" -k"tc:1c,2" -k"tcn:1c,2,3" -k"tl:2" -k"tln:2,3" -k"tlc:2c,3" -k"tlcn:2c,3,4" -k"sendT:2"
         -k"sendTn:2,3" -k"sendTc:2c,3" -k"sendTcn:2c,3,4"

    Example:

         xgettext -c -k -k"I.t" -k"I.tn:1,2" -k"I.tc:1c,2" -k"I.tcn:1c,2,3" -k"I.tl:2" -k"I.tln:2,3" -k"I.tlc:2c,3" \
         -k"I.tlcn:2c,3,4" -k"I.sendT:2" -k"I.sendTn:2,3" -k"I.sendTc:2c,3" -k"I.sendTcn:2c,3,4" -k"t" -k"tn:1,2" \
         -k"tc:1c,2" -k"tcn:1c,2,3" -k"tl:2" -k"tln:2,3" -k"tlc:2c,3" -k"tlcn:2c,3,4" -k"sendT:2" -k"sendTn:2,3" \
         -k"sendTc:2c,3" -k"sendTcn:2c,3,4" --from-code=utf-8 --output=lang.pot *.java

     # Or, recursively
     find . -iname "*.java" | xargs xgettext -c -k -k"I.t" -k"I.tn:1,2" -k"I.tc:1c,2" -k"I.tcn:1c,2,3" -k"I.tl:2" \
         -k"I.tln:2,3" -k"I.tlc:2c,3" -k"I.tlcn:2c,3,4" -k"I.sendT:2" -k"I.sendTn:2,3" -k"I.sendTc:2c,3" \
         -k"I.sendTcn:2c,3,4" -k"t" -k"tn:1,2" -k"tc:1c,2" -k"tcn:1c,2,3" -k"tl:2" -k"tln:2,3" -k"tlc:2c,3" \
         -k"tlcn:2c,3,4" -k"sendT:2" -k"sendTn:2,3" -k"sendTc:2c,3" -k"sendTcn:2c,3,4" \
         --from-code=utf-8 --output=lang.pot

      • tn

        public static String tn(String singular,
                        String plural,
                        Integer count,
                        Object... parameters)
        Translates the string with a plural.

        The count is likely to be used in the string, so if only a count is given, this count is also interpreted as a parameter (the first and only one, {0}). If this behavior annoys you, you can disable it using I18n.addCountToParameters(boolean).

        Parameters:
        singular - The singular version of the string.
        plural - The plural version of the string.
        count - The items count, used to choose the plural form according to the language plural rules.
        parameters - The parameters. See the class description for details.
        Returns:
        The translated string, with parameters incorporated, chosen according to the language plural rules.

public static String tn(Locale locale,

      • tc

        public static String tc(String context,
                        String text,
                        Object... parameters)
        Translates the string in the given context.

        The context is used when you have two identical strings to translate that may be translated differently according to the context.

        Parameters:
        context - The context.
        text - The string to translate.
        parameters - The parameters. See the class description for details.
        Returns:
        The translated string, with parameters incorporated.

      • tcn

        public static String tcn(String context,
                         String singular,
                         String plural,
                         Integer count,
                         Object... parameters)
        Translates the string in the given context, with a plural.

        The context is used when you have two identical strings to translate that may be translated differently according to the context.

        The count is likely to be used in the string, so if only a count is given, this count is also interpreted as a parameter (the first and only one, {0}). If this behavior annoys you, you can disable it using I18n.addCountToParameters(boolean).

        Parameters:
        context - The context.
        singular - The singular version of the string.
        plural - The plural version of the string.
        count - The items count, used to choose the plural form according to the language plural rules.
        parameters - The parameters. See the class description for details.
        Returns:
        The translated string, with parameters incorporated, chosen according to the language plural rules.

      • tcn

        public static String tcn(Locale locale,
                         String context,
                         String singular,
                         String plural,
                         Integer count,
                         Object... parameters)
        Deprecated. Use tlcn(Locale, String, String, String, Integer, Object...) for the gettext extractor to be able to read the strings.
        Translates the string in the given context, with a plural using the given locale.

        The context is used when you have two identical strings to translate that may be translated differently according to the context.

        The count is likely to be used in the string, so if only a count is given, this count is also interpreted as a parameter (the first and only one, {0}). If this behavior annoys you, you can disable it using I18n.addCountToParameters(boolean).

        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to use to translate the string.
        context - The context.
        singular - The singular version of the string.
        plural - The plural version of the string.
        count - The items count, used to choose the plural form according to the language plural rules.
        parameters - The parameters. See the class description for details.
        Returns:
        The translated string, with parameters incorporated, chosen according to the language plural rules.

                         String plural,
                         Integer count,

        The count is likely to be used in the string, so if only a count is given, this count is also interpreted as a parameter (the first and only one, {0}). If this behavior annoys you, you can disable it using I18n.addCountToParameters(boolean).

        locale - The locale to use to translate the string.
        singular - The singular version of the string.
        plural - The plural version of the string.
        count - The items count, used to choose the plural form according to the language plural rules.
        parameters - The parameters. See the class description for details.
        Returns:
        The translated string, with parameters incorporated, chosen according to the language plural rules.

        public static String tlcn(Locale locale,
                          String context,
                          String singular,
                          String plural,
                          Integer count,
                          Object... parameters)
        Translates the string in the given context, with a plural using the given locale.

        The context is used when you have two identical strings to translate that may be translated differently according to the context.

        The count is likely to be used in the string, so if only a count is given, this count is also interpreted as a parameter (the first and only one, {0}). If this behavior annoys you, you can disable it using I18n.addCountToParameters(boolean).

        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to use to translate the string.
        context - The context.
        singular - The singular version of the string.
        plural - The plural version of the string.
        count - The items count, used to choose the plural form according to the language plural rules.
        parameters - The parameters. See the class description for details.
        Returns:
        The translated string, with parameters incorporated, chosen according to the language plural rules.

        Translates the string in the given context, with a plural using the player's locale.

        The context is used when you have two identical strings to translate that may be translated differently according to the context.

        The count is likely to be used in the string, so if only a count is given, this count is also interpreted as a parameter (the first and only one, {0}). If this behavior annoys you, you can disable it using I18n.addCountToParameters(boolean).

        Parameters:
        player - The locale of this player will be used to translate the string.
        context - The context.
        singular - The singular version of the string.
        plural - The plural version of the string.
        count - The items count, used to choose the plural form according to the language plural rules.
        parameters - The parameters. See the class description for details.
        Returns:
        The translated string, with parameters incorporated, chosen according to the language plural rules.

      • sendTn

        public static void sendTn(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                          String singular,
                          String plural,
                          Integer count,
                          Object... parameters)
        Translates the string with a plural and sends it to the given player.

        The count is likely to be used in the string, so if only a count is given, this count is also interpreted as a parameter (the first and only one, {0}). If this behavior annoys you, you can disable it using I18n.addCountToParameters(boolean).

        Parameters:

        singular - The singular version of the string.
        plural - The plural version of the string.
        count - The items count, used to choose the plural form according to the language plural rules.
        parameters - The parameters. See the class description for details.

      • sendTcn

        public static void sendTcn(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                           String context,
                           String singular,
                           String plural,
                           Integer count,
                           Object... parameters)
        Translates the string in the given context, with a plural and sends it to the given player.

        The context is used when you have two identical strings to translate that may be translated differently according to the context.

        The count is likely to be used in the string, so if only a count is given, this count is also interpreted as a parameter (the first and only one, {0}). If this behavior annoys you, you can disable it using I18n.addCountToParameters(boolean).

        Parameters:
        player - The player to send the message to.
        context - The context.
        singular - The singular version of the string.
        plural - The plural version of the string.
        count - The items count, used to choose the plural form according to the language plural rules.
        parameters - The parameters. See the class description for details.
